scenarioDescription:
The YZ Cet Exoplanetary System


Overview

YZ Cet is a star with 0.13 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.17 times its radius. It is located 12.11 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 5 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

YZ Cet is known to have 3 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the YZ Cet system


YZ Cet b

YZ Cet b was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of YZ Cet b is 0.750 times the mass of Earth. The radius of YZ Cet b is 0.930 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, YZ Cet b is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.


YZ Cet c

YZ Cet c was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.02 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of YZ Cet c is 0.979 times the mass of Earth. The radius of YZ Cet c is 1.000 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, YZ Cet c is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.


YZ Cet d

YZ Cet d was discovered by the La Silla Observatory observatory, in 2017-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.03 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of YZ Cet d is 1.142 times the mass of Earth. The radius of YZ Cet d is 1.050 that of Earth. At less than 1.5 Earth masses, YZ Cet d is a regular terrestrial planet, much like the terrestrial planets we find in our solar system, namely Mercury, Venus, Earth and Mars.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system YZ Cet, which contains 3 exoplanets and was discovered by the La Silla Observatory.
name: YZ Cet - System With 3 Exoplanets
